alert.note: Alert for Curry; Quay (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 7:49PM MDT until May 24 at 11:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New Mexico, including the following counties, Curry and Quay. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 743 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to a severe thunderstorm approaching Clovis from the north. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding, as well as urban flooding in the Clovis area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have already fallen just north of Clovis. With a rain rate potentially reaching 4 inches per hour, flash flooding is highly likely in Clovis when the storm arrives between 8 to 9 PM MDT. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 4 inches are expected over the area. There is a high potential for flash flooding to develop. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clovis, Texico, Melrose, Ranchvale, Cannon Air Force Base, Saint Vrain, Portair, Pleasant Hill and Forrest. - This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between Mile Markers 362 and 397. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
